detaileddescription.para: Specifies that "inside" is computed by a non-zero sum of signed edge crossings
Specifies that "inside" is computed by an odd number of edge crossings
Same as Winding, but draws outside of the path, rather than inside
Same as EvenOdd, but draws outside of the path, rather than inside
Direction either has not been or could not be computed
clockwise direction for adding closed contours
counter-clockwise direction for adding closed contours
Source path contours are added as new contours.

Path is added by extending the last contour of the destination path with the first contour of the source path. If the last contour of the destination path is closed, then it will not be extended. Instead, the start of source path will be extended by a straight line to the end point of the destination path.
Return the path's fill type. This is used to define how "inside" is computed. The default value is kWinding_FillType.
Set the path's fill type. This is used to define how "inside" is computed. The default value is kWinding_FillType.

parameterdescription.para: The new fill type for this path

detaileddescription.para: Returns true if the filltype is one of the Inverse variants
Toggle between inverse and normal filltypes. This reverse the return value of isInverseFillType()
Return the path's convexity, as stored in the path. If it is currently unknown, then this function will attempt to compute the convexity (and cache the result).
Store a convexity setting in the path. There is no automatic check to see if this value actually agrees with the return value that would be computed by getConvexity().
Note: even if this is set to a "known" value, if the path is later changed (e.g. lineTo(), addRect(), etc.) then the cached value will be reset to kUnknown_Convexity.
Returns true if the path is flagged as being convex. This is not a confirmed by any analysis, it is just the value set earlier.
Returns true if the path is an oval.

parameterdescription.para: returns the bounding rect of this oval. It's a circle if the height and width are the same.

simplesect.para: true if this path is an oval. Tracking whether a path is an oval is considered an optimization for performance and so some paths that are in fact ovals can report false.

detaileddescription.para: Clear any lines and curves from the path, making it empty. This frees up internal storage associated with those segments. On Android, does not change fSourcePath.

Similar to reset(), in that all lines and curves are removed from the path. However, any internal storage for those lines/curves is retained, making reuse of the path potentially faster. On Android, does not change fSourcePath.
Returns true if the path is empty (contains no lines or curves)

simplesect.para: true if the path is empty (contains no lines or curves)

detaileddescription.para: Returns true if all of the points in this path are finite, meaning there are no infinities and no NaNs.

Returns true if the path specifies a single line (i.e. it contains just a moveTo and a lineTo). If so, and line[] is not null, it sets the 2 points in line[] to the end-points of the line. If the path is not a line, returns false and ignores line[].
Returns true if the path specifies a rectangle. If so, and if rect is not null, set rect to the bounds of the path. If the path does not specify a rectangle, return false and ignore rect.

parameterdescription.para: If not null, returns the bounds of the path if it specifies a rectangle

simplesect.para: true if the path specifies a rectangle

detaileddescription.para: Return the number of points in the path
Return the point at the specified index. If the index is out of range (i.e. is not 0 <= index < countPoints()) then the returned coordinates will be (0,0)
Returns the number of points in the path. Up to max points are copied.

parameterdescription.para: If not null, receives up to max points
The maximum number of points to copy into points

simplesect.para: the actual number of points in the path

detaileddescription.para: Return the number of verbs in the path
Returns the number of verbs in the path. Up to max verbs are copied. The verbs are copied as one byte per verb.

parameterdescription.para: If not null, receives up to max verbs
The maximum number of verbs to copy into verbs

simplesect.para: the actual number of verbs in the path

detaileddescription.para: Returns the bounds of the path's points. If the path contains 0 or 1 points, the bounds is set to (0,0,0,0), and isEmpty() will return true. Note: this bounds may be larger than the actual shape, since curves do not extend as far as their control points.
Set the beginning of the next contour to the point (x,y).

parameterdescription.para: The x-coordinate of the start of a new contour
The y-coordinate of the start of a new contour

detaileddescription.para: Set the beginning of the next contour relative to the last point on the previous contour. If there is no previous contour, this is treated the same as moveTo().

parameterdescription.para: The amount to add to the x-coordinate of the end of the previous contour, to specify the start of a new contour
The amount to add to the y-coordinate of the end of the previous contour, to specify the start of a new contour

detaileddescription.para: Add a line from the last point to the specified point (x,y). If no moveTo() call has been made for this contour, the first point is automatically set to (0,0).

parameterdescription.para: The x-coordinate of the end of a line
The y-coordinate of the end of a line

detaileddescription.para: Same as lineTo, but the coordinates are considered relative to the last point on this contour. If there is no previous point, then a moveTo(0,0) is inserted automatically.

parameterdescription.para: The amount to add to the x-coordinate of the previous point on this contour, to specify a line
The amount to add to the y-coordinate of the previous point on this contour, to specify a line

memberdef.argsstring: (float x1, float y1, float x2, float y2) PURE
memberdef.name: quadTo

detaileddescription.para: Add a quadratic bezier from the last point, approaching control point (x1,y1), and ending at (x2,y2). If no moveTo() call has been made for this contour, the first point is automatically set to (0,0).

parameterdescription.para: The x-coordinate of the control point on a quadratic curve
The y-coordinate of the control point on a quadratic curve
The x-coordinate of the end point on a quadratic curve
The y-coordinate of the end point on a quadratic curve

memberdef.argsstring: (float dx1, float dy1, float dx2, float dy2) PURE
memberdef.name: rQuadTo

detaileddescription.para: Same as quadTo, but the coordinates are considered relative to the last point on this contour. If there is no previous point, then a moveTo(0,0) is inserted automatically.

parameterdescription.para: The amount to add to the x-coordinate of the last point on this contour, to specify the control point of a quadratic curve
The amount to add to the y-coordinate of the last point on this contour, to specify the control point of a quadratic curve
The amount to add to the x-coordinate of the last point on this contour, to specify the end point of a quadratic curve
The amount to add to the y-coordinate of the last point on this contour, to specify the end point of a quadratic curve

memberdef.argsstring: (float x1, float y1, float x2, float y2, float w) PURE
memberdef.name: conicTo

memberdef.argsstring: (float dx1, float dy1, float dx2, float dy2, float w) PURE
memberdef.name: rConicTo

memberdef.argsstring: (float x1, float y1, float x2, float y2, float x3, float y3) PURE
memberdef.name: cubicTo

detaileddescription.para: Add a cubic bezier from the last point, approaching control points (x1,y1) and (x2,y2), and ending at (x3,y3). If no moveTo() call has been made for this contour, the first point is automatically set to (0,0).

parameterdescription.para: The x-coordinate of the 1st control point on a cubic curve
The y-coordinate of the 1st control point on a cubic curve
The x-coordinate of the 2nd control point on a cubic curve
The y-coordinate of the 2nd control point on a cubic curve
The x-coordinate of the end point on a cubic curve
The y-coordinate of the end point on a cubic curve

memberdef.argsstring: (float x1, float y1, float x2, float y2, float x3, float y3) PURE
memberdef.name: rCubicTo

detaileddescription.para: Same as cubicTo, but the coordinates are considered relative to the current point on this contour. If there is no previous point, then a moveTo(0,0) is inserted automatically.

parameterdescription.para: The amount to add to the x-coordinate of the last point on this contour, to specify the 1st control point of a cubic curve
The amount to add to the y-coordinate of the last point on this contour, to specify the 1st control point of a cubic curve
The amount to add to the x-coordinate of the last point on this contour, to specify the 2nd control point of a cubic curve
The amount to add to the y-coordinate of the last point on this contour, to specify the 2nd control point of a cubic curve
The amount to add to the x-coordinate of the last point on this contour, to specify the end point of a cubic curve
The amount to add to the y-coordinate of the last point on this contour, to specify the end point of a cubic curve

memberdef.argsstring: (const RECT &oval, float startAngle, float sweepAngle, bool forceMoveTo) PURE
memberdef.name: arcTo

detaileddescription.para: Append the specified arc to the path as a new contour. If the start of the path is different from the path's current last point, then an automatic lineTo() is added to connect the current contour to the start of the arc. However, if the path is empty, then we call moveTo() with the first point of the arc. The sweep angle is treated mod 360.

parameterdescription.para: The bounding oval defining the shape and size of the arc
Starting angle (in degrees) where the arc begins
Sweep angle (in degrees) measured clockwise. This is treated mod 360.
If true, always begin a new contour with the arc

memberdef.argsstring: (float x1, float y1, float x2, float y2, float radius) PURE
memberdef.name: arcTo

detaileddescription.para: Append a line and arc to the current path. This is the same as the PostScript call "arct".
Close the current contour. If the current point is not equal to the first point of the contour, a line segment is automatically added.

Returns true if the path specifies a rectangle. If so, and if isClosed is not null, set isClosed to true if the path is closed. Also, if returning true and direction is not null, return the rect direction. If the path does not specify a rectangle, return false and ignore isClosed and direction.

parameterdescription.para: If not null, set to true if the path is closed
If not null, set to the rectangle's direction

simplesect.para: true if the path specifies a rectangle

detaileddescription.para:
Add a closed rectangle contour to the path
rect
The rectangle to add as a closed contour to the path
dir
The direction to wind the rectangle's contour. Cannot be kUnknown_Direction.

memberdef.argsstring: (float left, float top, float right, float bottom, Direction dir=kCW_Direction) PURE
memberdef.name: addRect

detaileddescription.para: Add a closed rectangle contour to the path

parameterdescription.para: The left side of a rectangle to add as a closed contour to the path
The top of a rectangle to add as a closed contour to the path
The right side of a rectangle to add as a closed contour to the path
The bottom of a rectangle to add as a closed contour to the path
The direction to wind the rectangle's contour. Cannot be kUnknown_Direction.

detaileddescription.para: Add a closed oval contour to the path

parameterdescription.para: The bounding oval to add as a closed contour to the path
The direction to wind the oval's contour. Cannot be kUnknown_Direction.

memberdef.argsstring: (float x, float y, float radius, Direction dir=kCW_Direction) PURE
memberdef.name: addCircle

detaileddescription.para: Add a closed circle contour to the path

parameterdescription.para: The x-coordinate of the center of a circle to add as a closed contour to the path
The y-coordinate of the center of a circle to add as a closed contour to the path
The radius of a circle to add as a closed contour to the path
The direction to wind the circle's contour. Cannot be kUnknown_Direction.

memberdef.argsstring: (const RECT &oval, float startAngle, float sweepAngle) PURE
memberdef.name: addArc

detaileddescription.para: Add the specified arc to the path as a new contour.

parameterdescription.para: The bounds of oval used to define the size of the arc
Starting angle (in degrees) where the arc begins
Sweep angle (in degrees) measured clockwise

memberdef.argsstring: (const RECT &rect, float rx, float ry, Direction dir=kCW_Direction) PURE
memberdef.name: addRoundRect

detaileddescription.para:
Add a closed round-rectangle contour to the path
rect
The bounds of a round-rectangle to add as a closed contour
rx
The x-radius of the rounded corners on the round-rectangle
ry
The y-radius of the rounded corners on the round-rectangle
dir
The direction to wind the rectangle's contour. Cannot be kUnknown_Direction.

memberdef.argsstring: (const RECT &rect, const float radii[], Direction dir=kCW_Direction) PURE
memberdef.name: addRoundRect

detaileddescription.para:
Add a closed round-rectangle contour to the path. Each corner receives two radius values [X, Y]. The corners are ordered top-left, top-right, bottom-right, bottom-left.
rect
The bounds of a round-rectangle to add as a closed contour
radii
Array of 8 scalars, 4 [X,Y] pairs for each corner
dir
The direction to wind the rectangle's contour. Cannot be kUnknown_Direction. Note: The radii here now go through the same constraint handling as the SkRRect radii (i.e., either radii at a corner being 0 implies a sqaure corner and oversized radii are proportionally scaled down).

memberdef.argsstring: (const POINT pts[], int count, bool close) PURE
memberdef.name: addPoly

detaileddescription.para: Add a new contour made of just lines. This is just a fast version of the following: this->moveTo(pts[0]); for (int i = 1; i < count; ++i) { this->lineTo(pts[i]); } if (close) { this->close(); }

memberdef.argsstring: (const IPath *src, float dx, float dy, AddPathMode mode=kAppend_AddPathMode) PURE
memberdef.name: addPath

detaileddescription.para:
Add a copy of src to the path, offset by (dx,dy)
src
The path to add as a new contour
dx
The amount to translate the path in X as it is added
dx
The amount to translate the path in Y as it is added
Same as addPath(), but reverses the src input
Offset the path by (dx,dy), returning true on success

parameterdescription.para: The amount in the X direction to offset the entire path
The amount in the Y direction to offset the entire path

detaileddescription.para: Transform the points in this path by matrix

parameterdescription.para: The matrix to apply to the path

detaileddescription.para: Return the last point on the path. If no points have been added, (0,0) is returned. If there are no points, this returns false, otherwise it returns true.

parameterdescription.para: The last point on the path is returned here

detaileddescription.para: Set the last point on the path. If no points have been added, moveTo(x,y) is automatically called.

parameterdescription.para: The new x-coordinate for the last point
The new y-coordinate for the last point

memberdef.argsstring: (LPCTSTR pszText, int nLen, float x, float y, const IFont *pFont) PURE
memberdef.name: addString
